There's a special irony when Google CEO Eric Schmidt suggests-as he did in a speech to the Council on Foreign Relations last November-that China's government will find it impossible to censor a billion phones that are trying to express themselves. Eric Schmidt is rich because his company sells precisely targeted ads against hundreds of millions of search requests per day. If Google can zero in like that, so can China's censors. Laurence Lovejoy stabbed, beat, poisoned and drowned Waubonsie Valley High School sophomore Erin Justice in Aurora. Justice's mother found the 16-year-old's body in a bathtub of their townhome in March, 2004. He left her to drown in a pool of her own blood, DuPage County Assistant State's Attorney Michael Vick Pawl said during closing arguments Tuesday.
